contextId.information: "Rejoice" and "be very glad" mean almost the same thing. Jesus wanted his hearers not merely to rejoice but to do even more than rejoice if possible. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

Here "meek" and "lowly in heart" mean basically the same thing. Jesus combines them to emphasize that he will be much more kind than the religious leaders. AT: "I am gentle and humble" (UDB) or "I am very gentle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: I am meek and lowly in heart
